timeline.message:
CancellableThenSubscription avoiding infinite loop

Motivation:
CancellableThenSubscription may get into an infinite loop if
setSubscription method is called twice. This is invalid usage as
described by the API but there are issues that suggest this may be
occurring [1][2][3] and if it does we should avoid infinite looping.

[1] https://github.com/apple/servicetalk/issues/744
[2] https://github.com/apple/servicetalk/issues/1040
[3] https://github.com/apple/servicetalk/issues/1053

Modifications:
- Rename CancellableThenSubscription to
DelayedCancellableThenSubscription
- Leverage DelayedCancellable and DelayedSubscription existing code to
construct DelayedCancellableThenSubscription to share code and lower
complexity

Result:
DelayedCancellableThenSubscription prevents infinite loops. This may
impact the following operators:
- Single#flatMapPublisher(..)
- Completable#concat(Publisher)
- Single#concat(Publisher)
make tests more forgiving with invalid requestn matching

timeline.bodyText:
Is this useful anywhere else but for the concat case?
Can the switch between cancellable and subscription be local to DelayedCancellableThenSubscription?
timeline.author: NiteshKant

replies.bodyText:
DelayedCancellableThenSubscription is the only consumer of this API.
Options to accomplish dereference:

DelayedCancellable#cancel() - this may involve additional offloading and complicates the control flow a bit.
DelayedCancellable#disableCancellable - adds extra protected method to the API. The API
DelayedCancellableThenSubscription to duplicate DelayedCancellable logic - logic isn't overly complicated so may not be a deal breaker, but more code duplication.

I'll update to the last option to avoid API change.
replies.author: Scottmitch

timeline.bodyText: I considered making DelayedSubscription non-final and extending it, but lets defer this for a followup PR if necessary.
